S.FORM: sãba paŋbhe'ttho abhedaŋba thik wayɛ phɛllɛ əghi mɔna kɛdzaba thik wayɛ.
S.TRANSL: In Samba village, before, there was a man-eating ogre.

S.FORM: kanayɔŋba mɛmɛttu kumiŋ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: His name was Kanayongba.

S.FORM: tərə kha kanayɔŋb'ɛllɛ ɛmbha thikyaːn thiklɛ thikyaːllɛ thikthik thikthik co suba mɔnahaˀ.
S.TRANSL: Day by day, one by one, this Kanayongba was finishing off the people.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kha kanayɔŋba mɛtmunaŋ kɔ ɛmbha thikyaːn thikthik thikthik khunɛ kudɔːk mɛyuksu mɛburu — mɛyuksu mɛburuba.
S.TRANSL: Each day they would set someone out for him as his meal.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ thik sikari mɛtmunaba thik mu tak kɔnnu tak kɔnnu mu y'yɛ mu.
S.TRANSL: Then a hunter came wandering down [one day to the place where a girl had been left for K.]

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ kha sikari 'llɛ kɔ mu " ləu nani ɛtmu himdaŋba kɛwaˀi kɛhoptɛi kɔ" phɛaŋ kɔ sen tosusi'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: [[The hunter asked, "Child, is there a householder here or not?"

S.FORM: "wayigɛ a thɛbae" mɛttusi — mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: "We're here, grandfather," she said.]] [seems confused.]

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ "khɛnɛ ek kɛyuŋŋi nani ?" mɛttu'llɛ ni
S.TRANSL: Then, "Are you staying here alone?"

S.FORM: "iŋga kɔ kanayɔŋb'ɛllɛ kudɔːk mɛyuksaŋaŋ yuŋŋaba thɛbae" mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: "They've set me here as a meal for Kanayongba, grandfather," she said.

S.FORM: " ləu khɔmbhɔrɔ khɛnɛ bhitri pegɛaŋ mi tuptɛ! mɛŋgiɛ! iŋga kha kanayɔŋb'ɛn sɛruŋ pinɛ" mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: "Well now you go inside and start up the fire. Don't be afraid! I'll kill that Kanayongba for you," he said.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ khunɛ kɔ him bhitri pegɛaŋ mi tuptɛ.
S.TRANSL: So she went in and kindled the fire.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ "akkho kɔ kanayɔŋb'ɛn ʈhikkə ɔːkkɛllɛ bela khɛnɛ him bhitri ciŋsiŋŋɛaŋ yuŋɛ!
S.TRANSL: "Now later, as soon as Kanayongba starts roaring, you hide inside the house and stay there!

S.FORM: iŋga lo'llɛ kitnasiŋŋa yuŋŋa" mɛttu kha sikari 'llɛ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: I'll stay rolled up inside a mat," said the hunter.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ kanayɔŋb'ɛn pəhila ɔːktɛ'llɛ mu khola 'llɛ kuya'tmu ɔːktɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then when Kanayongba gave his first cry — he roared down beside the river.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ lupli kɛgɛtpa kusik mu lɔˀrɛ mu.
S.TRANSL: It was like an earthquake.

S.FORM: yammu thiklɛŋ ɔːktɛ'llɛ kɔ mu ɛtthaŋdhak ɔːktɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then when he roared again, he roared higher up.

S.FORM: yammu lupli kɛgɛtpa kusik mu lɔˀrɛ.
S.TRANSL: Again it was like an earthquake.

S.FORM: yammu thiklɛŋ ɔːktɛ'llɛ kɔ lɔkkhummɛtmu ɔːktɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then when he roared again, it was in the front yard.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ kum'ra'tmu kɛlaːtpa kɛbekpa kusik mu lɔˀrɛ mu.
S.TRANSL: The hunter made as if to go inside his mouth.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ lɔːndɛaŋ kha sikari 'llɛ mu mɛttu mu.
S.TRANSL: The hunter came out and told him,

S.FORM: " ləu khɛnɛ kɔ mɔna kɛdzabanɛ rətchə khɛnɛ ləu
S.TRANSL: "OK, you're a man-eater, it seems,

S.FORM: khɔmbhɔgɔrɔ alla iŋga c'yaŋŋɛ khɛnɛ!
S.TRANSL: so now eat me!

S.FORM: khɛnɛ c'yaŋŋɛ! khɛnɛ kɛhimmunu kɛdhaŋɛba iŋga ɛtmu ahimmutarik.
S.TRANSL: Eat me! You've come to my house all the way up from your house.

S.FORM: kɛmikkɛn immɛttɛ!
S.TRANSL: Close your eyes!

S.FORM: kɛm'ra hɔŋ mɛttɛaŋ yuŋɛ! iŋga kɛm'ra bhitri pinna laːtna!" mɛttu sikari 'llɛ.
S.TRANSL: Open your mouth and hold still! I'll jump into your mouth!" said the hunter.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ khunɛ kɔ — kanayɔŋb'ɛllɛ kɔ kum'ra hɔŋ mɛttuaŋ kumikkɛn immɛttuaŋ yɛbɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then Kanayongba opened his mouth and closed his eyes and stood there.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ toŋ li yaŋɛllɛ kɔ khunɛ nɛsiŋŋaŋ kulaŋŋɛllɛ lɛˀru. kuhukkɛllɛ uːksu.
S.TRANSL: Then when the hunter took up his bow, he lay down and stretched it with his legs. He pulled it back with his hands.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ toŋŋɛllɛ abu kɔrɔ na kudhɔkk'rɔŋb'ɛtmu lasɛaŋ kɔ kuluŋm'ɛtmu kɛrɛrɔ abu rətchə .
S.TRANSL: He shot the arrow — he shot it so that it went into Kanayongba's throat reaching his heart.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ condɛ.
S.TRANSL: He fell over.

S.FORM: condɛ'llɛ kɔ lupli kɛgɛtpa kusik lɔˀrɛ.
S.TRANSL: When he fell over, it was like an earthquake.

S.FORM: kudhɛgekkɛn kɔ mu miwa ma c'waːttɛtmu lasɛ.
S.TRANSL: His head went into the river Mewa.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ c'waːttɛn sɔpma saktu nɛssu.
S.TRANSL: The water was blocked for a time.

S.FORM: saktu nɛssu'llɛ kɔ the ni poksɛ kɔ phɛaŋ thaŋ pɔn ɛtmu jəŋgəl ɛtmu kɛbekpaŋ kɛyaːkpahaˀrɛ mu o mɛmɛttu'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: The flow was blocked, and then what happened was, when those who had gone up and stayed over in the forest looked down,

S.FORM: " ləu alla indɛn co tesu rətchə ani san kɔ" phɛaŋ khunchi mɛhaːbɛaŋ mɛyuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: they said, "Well, by now he's already eaten her up," and they wept.

S.FORM: mɛhaːbɛaŋ mɛyuŋɛ'llɛ kɔ akkho sɔpma yaŋ ɛtmu o mɛmɛttu'llɛ kɔ himmɛtmu kɔ mikkhu mu susɛ mu.
S.TRANSL: They went on weeping and then a bit later when they looked again there was smoke wafting up from the house.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ mikkhu susɛ.
S.TRANSL: Smoke wafted up.

S.FORM: khɔmbhasaŋ s'waʔ mɛyuŋɛ khunchi kɔ
S.TRANSL: Even so, they sat silently.

S.FORM: "alla kanayɔŋb'ɛn pei mɛmbekkɛ waˀi?" phɛaŋ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: "Has Kanayongba gone or not?" they wondered.

S.FORM: kanayɔŋb'ɛn condɛ'llɛ kɔ condɛ'llɛ kɔ condɛaŋ kha himmu kanayɔŋb'ɛllɛ kudɔːk mɛyuksub'ɛllɛ kɔ peaŋ him bhitri mi tuptu.
S.TRANSL: Kanayongba had fallen, and in the house, the one who had been left for Kanayongba's meal kindled the fire.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ sikari kɛdzokpa mɔnan kɔ parama thi puru.
S.TRANSL: She gave millet beer to the hunter.

S.FORM: thi thuŋɛ yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: He stayed drinking beer.

S.FORM: mikkhu susɛ'llɛ kɔ kumba kummarɛ mɛnisuaŋ kɔ " ləu mikkhu su.
S.TRANSL: When the smoke wafted up, her parents saw it and said, "Well! There's smoke.

S.FORM: pegi saˀri himmu the poksɛi?" phɛaŋ thonu mɛy'yɛ kɔrɔ kusannaŋ yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: Let's go have a look what's going on in the house." When they came down, their daughter was sitting there,

S.FORM: kusen mɛnnisumba mɔna thikkaŋ kappoba thikkaŋ khapmu yuŋɛ kɔrɛ.
S.TRANSL: and a man they didn't recognize — an old man — was there too.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ ni hɛna mɛmuyɛrɔ mɛbe kɔrɔ "khɛnɛ atti kɛyuŋbanɛ? attinu kɛbe?" mɛmɛttu'llɛ ni
S.TRANSL: They talked: "Where do you live? Which way are you going?"

S.FORM: "iŋga ɛmbha sikar kɛdzokpa mɔnaa.
S.TRANSL: "I'm a hunting man.

S.FORM: khɛni san ɛmbha kanayɔŋb'ɛllɛ kudɔːk kɛyuksummaŋ yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: You left your daughter here as food for Kanayongba.

S.FORM: kanayɔŋb'ɛn iŋga sɛruŋ.
S.TRANSL: I killed Kanayongba.

S.FORM: sɛruŋŋaŋ ɛmbha yuŋŋa" pha mɛttusi.
S.TRANSL: I killed him and here I am," he told them.

S.FORM: " ləu hɔmbhɔgɔrɔ khɛnɛ kanayɔŋba kɛsɛpp'ɛllɛ ɛmbha anigɛ san cuːkm'ɛn teˀrɛ khɛnɛ!"
S.TRANSL: "Well, then, killer of Kanayongba, take her, our youngest daughter!"

S.FORM: mɛmɛttuaŋ khunchi mɛburu kumba kummarɛ. mɛburu.
S.TRANSL: they said and they gave her to him — her parents gave her to him.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ mɛburuaŋ khatmu wayɛ pe'llɛ kɔ kha kusan kɔ "alla then pima ani san?" phɛaŋ kumba — kapponu kapmu səllah — kapponu kapmu khunchi cumluŋ cogɛsi.
S.TRANSL: Then when their daughter was leaving, the old man and the old woman took counsel and said, "Now what should we give her?"

S.FORM: cumluŋ cogɛsi'llɛ kɔ " ləu alla ani san luŋma aduk.
S.TRANSL: They took counsel, "Now we'll miss our daughter.

S.FORM: luŋma adukɛllɛ kɔ the ni pima?
S.TRANSL: What to give her?

S.FORM: ani theaŋ aŋgɔttummɛn."
S.TRANSL: We don't have anything.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ "paŋ thik ni pima" phɛaŋ kɔ yammu paŋ mɛburu kusan.
S.TRANSL: We'll give her a ball of wool," they said, and they gave a ball of wool (? pang) to their daughter.

S.FORM: paŋ mɛburuaŋ kɔ mɛburu'llɛ kɔ taːndi paŋbɔhaŋ libaŋ taŋba thik yammu khunɛ ku thər lɔːndɛ kusa mɛnchuma'llɛ kusa yɛmbitcha mu.
S.TRANSL: They gave her a ball of wool and afterwards her clan became pangbohang libang — their daughter's sons' clan.

S.FORM: khɔmdaŋba thər thik lɔːndɛaŋ kanayɔŋba kɛsɛpp'ɛllɛ kusa'llɛ kumiŋ kɔ ku thər kɔ paŋbɔhaŋ libaŋ mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: So a clan was born — the sons of the killer of Kanayongba — their name — their clan was called Pangbohang Libang.

S.FORM: li kɔttu'llɛ libaŋ poksɛba.
S.TRANSL: Since he had a bow, it became Libang.

S.FORM: paŋŋɛn mɛyoˀru mɛburu'llɛ daijo mɛburu'llɛ paŋbɔʔma poksɛba ro pha.
S.TRANSL: And since they threw in a ball of wool as dowry, it became Pangbopma.

S.FORM: ɛmbha rɔt lɛsuŋ sər
S.TRANSL: That's all I know, sir.
